trans-unit.source: Retrieves information about the specified registry key

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves information about the specified registry key

target.mrk: Retrieves information about the specified registry key

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to an open registry key. The key must have been opened with the $KEY_QUERY_VALUE access right.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to an open registry key.
The key must have been opened with the $KEY_QUERY_VALUE access right.

target.mrk: Handle to an open registry key.
The key must have been opened with the $KEY_QUERY_VALUE access right.

trans-unit.source: This handle is returned by the _WinAPI_RegCreateKey() or _WinAPI_RegOpenKey() function. It can also

seg-source.mrk: This handle is returned by the _WinAPI_RegCreateKey() or _WinAPI_RegOpenKey() function.
It can also

target.mrk: This handle is returned by the _WinAPI_RegCreateKey() or _WinAPI_RegOpenKey() function.
It can also

trans-unit.source: be one of the following predefined keys.

seg-source.mrk: be one of the following predefined keys.

target.mrk: be one of the following predefined keys.

trans-unit.source: $HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT

seg-source.mrk: $HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT

target.mrk: $HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT

trans-unit.source: $HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG

seg-source.mrk: $HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG

target.mrk: $HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG

trans-unit.source: $HKEY_CURRENT_USER

seg-source.mrk: $HKEY_CURRENT_USER

target.mrk: $HKEY_CURRENT_USER

trans-unit.source: $HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE

seg-source.mrk: $HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE

target.mrk: $HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE

trans-unit.source: $HKEY_PERFORMANCE_DATA

seg-source.mrk: $HKEY_PERFORMANCE_DATA

target.mrk: $HKEY_PERFORMANCE_DATA

trans-unit.source: $HKEY_USERS

seg-source.mrk: $HKEY_USERS

target.mrk: $HKEY_USERS

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: The array containing the following information:

seg-source.mrk: The array containing the following information:

target.mrk: The array containing the following information:

trans-unit.source: [0] - The number of subkeys that are contained by the specified key.

seg-source.mrk: [0] - The number of subkeys that are contained by the specified key.

target.mrk: [0] - The number of subkeys that are contained by the specified key.

trans-unit.source: [1] - The size of the key's subkey with the longest name, in characters, not including the terminating null character.

seg-source.mrk: [1] - The size of the key's subkey with the longest name, in characters, not including the terminating null character.

target.mrk: [1] - The size of the key's subkey with the longest name, in characters, not including the terminating null character.

trans-unit.source: [2] - The number of values that are associated with the key.

seg-source.mrk: [2] - The number of values that are associated with the key.

target.mrk: [2] - The number of values that are associated with the key.

trans-unit.source: [3] - The size of the key's longest value name, in characters. The size does not include the terminating null character.

seg-source.mrk: [3] - The size of the key's longest value name, in characters.
The size does not include the terminating null character.

target.mrk: [3] - The size of the key's longest value name, in characters.
The size does not include the terminating null character.

trans-unit.source: [4] - The size of the longest data component among the key's values, in bytes.

seg-source.mrk: [4] - The size of the longest data component among the key's values, in bytes.

target.mrk: [4] - The size of the longest data component among the key's values, in bytes.

trans-unit.source: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

seg-source.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

target.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.
